column4: i can't get my driver to show up in the hardware drivers window... i know my graphics card is supported, but it still tries to load the drivers for my previous card
and i tried to install the drivers manually but they're all .rpm files
please, this is the most frustrating thing ever.. having hardware that i KNOW will work and having it not work
my videocard is supported but i can't get the darn drivers
I do not believe  that the currenly fglrx driver support the radeon 9800.  You should be getting 3d support from the open source radeon driver that comes with Ubuntu.
PHew. good thing i don't have a radeon 9800
i took that one out, pici
i put one i knew would work in it
and i KNOW it works, i've used it before
soooo... does this mean all of the ati drivers are broken now or what
i guess that means "yes, all of the drivers are broken"
Can I assume that you've already looked in System>Adminstration>Hardware Drivers?
pici: i could have sworn the radeon 9600 worked like a year ago for me
Just because it worked a year ago doesn't mean that fglrx still supports it.  My x1400 card used to be supported fglrx, but now I must use the radeon driver.
